Dr. Supraja is a proud mother of two beautiful girls currently aged 12 and 17 years. Her husband, Dr Chandrasekar, and family are her greatest strength and direction in this journey to lead a purposeful life.

summary: Dr. Prajakta Joshi Ranade is a senior paediatrician at Cloudnine Hospital. Her expertise is in treating childhood rheumatological illnesses along with care of newborn, general paediatrics (common cold, flu, wheezing, diarrhea), paediatric nutrition, preventive paediatrics, respiratory disorders and developmental disorders. As a trained Paediatric Rheumatologist her expertise in treating childhood rheumatological illnesses include Juvenile arthritis, Systemic lupus erythematosus, Dermatomyositis, Scleroderma, and other autoimmune illnesses, Autoinflammatory diseases and Periodic fevers and prolonged fevers.  After completing her undergraduate from RCSM Government Medical College, Kolhapur, she pursued her MD at the Vaishampayan Memorial Government Medical College, Solapur. She has had vast exposure to paediatric subspecialities working at multiple centers in Mumbai including Tata Memorial Hospital (Paediatric Oncology), Fortis Raheja (Neonatology) & Jaslok Hospital & Research Center (Paediatric Rheumatology, Neurology, Nephrology, Endocrinology).  She further completed IAP Fellowship in Paediatric Rheumatology under the mentorship of Dr. Raju Khubchandani at Jaslok Hospital, Mumbai. She worked at the prestigious St. John’s Medical College, Bangalore before starting her independent practice.  Dr. Prajakta has presented papers at many national and international rheumatology conferences and has been a crucial part in the development of pmmonline.india.org and PROCIN (Paediatric Rheumatology Online Course IAP Newcastle), a platform for raising awareness in paediatric rheumatological disorders and musculoskeletal problems in children. She has several publications in peer-reviewed journals to her credit.
